Overview.title: Who are we ?
Overview.textFirst: ECMC is a leading consulting company in Saudi Arabia, dedicated to empowering businesses for sustainable growth and success in local and global markets. With expertise in strategy, digital transformation, risk management, and more, we deliver tailored solutions across diverse sectors. Our team of experienced professionals focuses on innovation, excellence, and achieving client-specific objectives.
Overview.textSecond: We are committed to enhancing competitive advantage through high-quality, customized consulting services. At ECMC, trust and long-term partnerships form the foundation of our client relationships.

overview.title: Services
overview.subTitle: Expert Consulting for Your Business Growth
overview.text1: At ECMC, we provide innovative consulting solutions designed to help businesses navigate complex challenges and seize new opportunities. Our expertise spans strategy, operations, technology, and organizational transformation, empowering companies to enhance performance and achieve sustainable growth. Whether you're a startup or an established enterprise, our tailored approach ensures practical, actionable solutions that drive real results. Discover how ECMC can partner with you to unlock your business's full potential.

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.subTitle: Crafting Tailored, Professional Marketing Strategies to Drive Sustainable Growth
strategies.text1: At Emergence Capabilities Management Consulting (ECMC), we specialize in developing highly customized, professional marketing strategies that enable Saudi businesses to achieve sustained growth, enhance brand value, and engage effectively with their target audiences. Our deep understanding of the Saudi market and its unique dynamics allows us to design marketing solutions that are specifically aligned with your business goals and customer needs.
strategies.text2: Our services cover every aspect of marketing strategy, from market analysis and customer segmentation to brand positioning, integrated communication strategies, and performance measurement. We work closely with your team to create actionable, results-driven strategies that resonate with local and international audiences while ensuring maximum return on investment.
strategies.text3: Whether you're looking to launch a new product, refine your brand’s presence, or enter new market segments, ECMC’s tailored marketing strategies provide the expertise and precision needed to meet your objectives. With extensive experience across 21+ sectors, we empower Saudi businesses to establish a competitive edge in a rapidly evolving marketplace, contributing to the Kingdom’s economic goals under Vision 2030.
items: Market Research and Local Economy Studies

organizationalExcellency.title: Organizational excellency
organizationalExcellency.subTitle: Empowering Saudi Organizations with Tailored Excellence Solutions for Sustainable Growth
organizationalExcellency.text1: At Emergence Capabilities Management Consulting (ECMC), we specialize in driving organizational excellence for Saudi businesses by providing customized solutions designed to enhance performance, streamline operations, and foster sustainable success. With a deep understanding of the Saudi market and global best practices, we help organizations build resilient structures that adapt to evolving business environments.
organizationalExcellency.text2: Our services include governance frameworks, business process optimization, operational efficiency, risk management, and continuous improvement initiatives. By focusing on strengthening internal capabilities, we empower organizations to achieve their strategic goals, improve their competitive positioning, and ensure long-term resilience.
organizationalExcellency.text3: Whether you are seeking to enhance operational efficiency, strengthen governance, or implement innovative performance strategies, ECMC is your trusted partner. With proven expertise across 21+ sectors and a commitment to excellence, we help Saudi organizations thrive in a fast-changing market, contributing to the Kingdom’s broader economic development goals under Vision 2030.
items: Governance, risk, compliance and business continuity

marketing.title: Marketing
marketing.subTitle: Driving Marketing Excellence for Saudi Businesses with Innovative, Tailored Strategies.
marketing.text1: At Emergence Capabilities Management Consulting (ECMC), we empower Saudi businesses to stand out in today’s competitive market through innovative, data-driven marketing solutions. Our deep understanding of the local market, combined with global expertise, allows us to deliver customized strategies that resonate with target audiences and drive sustainable growth.
marketing.text2: From crafting impactful brand identities and developing comprehensive marketing strategies to optimizing communication channels and conducting in-depth market research, our marketing services are designed to enhance your brand’s presence, improve customer engagement, and maximize ROI.
marketing.text3: Whether you’re a growing business looking to establish your brand or a leading organization seeking to refine your market positioning, ECMC is your trusted partner. With a strong track record of success across 21+ sectors, we help businesses in Saudi Arabia create meaningful connections with their customers and achieve long-term success in an ever-evolving marketplace.

naser.name: Naser
naser.text: Nasser is a General Manager in Consulting Services, and has deep general experience with major international companies in the Middle East in many transformation, governance and organizational excellence projects, as well as his experience in developing various governance manuals, in addition to preparing and implementing many workshops and seminars in various local and regional conferences in various areas of expertise.

yazan.name: Yazan
yazan.text: Yazan has more than ten years of experience in the private sector and major consulting companies, where Yazan provided advisory services to the public, private and government sectors through the establishment and operation of governance, risk, compliance and internal audit units in accordance with the standards issued by the International Organization for Standards and Standards issued by the Institute of Internal Auditors. Yazan's experience also extends to providing support to clients in developing contingency plans and dealing with crises to ensure business continuity for the main activities of the facility in accordance with the ISO 22301 standard.

about.title: About us
about.subTitle: We’re Not Just Different—We’re the Golden Standard, Leading with Bold Vision and Unmatched Excellence.
about.text1: At Emergence Capabilities Management Consulting (ECMC), we are a leading consulting firm in Saudi Arabia, dedicated to empowering businesses to achieve sustainable growth and excel in both local and global markets. With a commitment to innovation and excellence, ECMC offers a wide range of consulting services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients across various sectors, including strategy and planning, digital transformation, risk management, project management, marketing and branding, human resources, and innovation.
about.text2: Our core mission is to be the trusted strategic partner for our clients, providing customized solutions that help them reach their strategic objectives, enhance their competitive advantage, and ensure long-term success. We leverage the expertise of our highly skilled team of professionals to deliver top-quality services while building lasting relationships based on trust, collaboration, and mutual respect.
about.text3: We understand the challenges businesses face in today’s fast-evolving landscape. Our goal is to help our clients navigate these challenges by strengthening their organizational capabilities and preparing them for sustainable growth. Whether it’s improving operational efficiency, developing innovative strategies, or enhancing governance frameworks, ECMC is here to help Saudi organizations thrive.

vision.title: vision
vision.text: To be the leading consulting firm in Saudi Arabia, providing innovative solutions that drive excellence in risk management, governance, compliance, business continuity, institutional excellence, and strategic development.

mission.title: mission
mission.text: We are committed to delivering exceptional and comprehensive consulting services across multiple domains to help our clients enhance their institutional capabilities, adapt to evolving challenges, and contribute to the creation of a vibrant society and thriving economy in Saudi Arabia.

innovation.text: If you’re looking for a place where you can be your authentic self, bring bold ideas to life, and thrive in a culture of innovation and excellence, ECMC is the company for you.

marketing-specialist.title: Marketing Specialist
marketing-specialist.summary: We are seeking a versatile and results-driven Marketing Specialist to support our offline, online, and event marketing efforts. This role is responsible for executing integrated marketing campaigns, supporting brand initiatives, and driving engagement across various platforms. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of digital and traditional marketing strategies, excellent project management skills, and experience in coordinating events to elevate our brand and achieve business objectives.
responsibilities: Develop and execute online marketing campaigns across social media, email, and paid advertising channels to drive brand awareness and engagement.
Analyze digital campaign performance using metrics and insights, making data-driven recommendations to optimize future efforts.
Support the planning and execution of offline marketing activities, such as print advertising, direct mail campaigns, and brochures.
Coordinate with designers and vendors to produce high-quality marketing collateral that aligns with brand standards.
Organize, coordinate, and execute corporate events, trade shows, and conferences to maximize brand exposure and build client relationships.
Handle event logistics, including venue selection, vendor coordination, and on-site support.
Work with the marketing team to develop event materials such as banners, booths, presentations, and promotional items.
Track event success through post-event analysis and identify opportunities for improvement in future events.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in marketing, with exposure to digital marketing, offline channels, and event coordination.
Demonstrated experience managing marketing campaigns across both digital and traditional channels.
Proficiency in marketing software and tools, such as Google Analytics, social media platforms, and email marketing platforms.
Familiarity with CRM systems, SEO, and SEM practices is a plus.
Proven track record of organizing and executing successful events.
skills: Strong project management skills with the ability to coordinate multiple marketing initiatives simultaneously.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for clear, persuasive messaging.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms, including social media management, email marketing, and analytics tools.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments and with external partners, including designers, vendors, and event coordinators.
Analytical skills to interpret data and generate actionable insights for campaign improvement.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

associate-consultant.title: Associate Consultant
associate-consultant.summary: ECMC is one of the largest local management consultancies in Saudi Arabia, and the market leader in providing multidisciplinary services for both the private and public sectors. The company offers consulting solutions in the areas of Strategy, Marketing, Operations & Organizational Excellence, and Digital, to a range of clients in both the public and private sectors. The company is heavily involved in the transformation era of Saudi Arabia, driven by the Vision 2030 initiative, in engagement with various government organizations and the Vision Realization Programs as well as the private sector. ECMC has delivered projects in more than 17 sectors for the most well-known entities in the public sector including ministries, regulatory authorities, and the Saudi Stock Exchange, as well major private sector entities in the Kingdom. Today, ECMC has offices in Riyadh and Jeddah in Saudi Arabia, as well as an office in Cairo and in London. The company is currently expanding its operations in Cairo and is hiring to support this growth. ECMC is looking for an Associate Consultant to join the team in Egypt. Ideally, you will have consulting experience gained through previous work experience.
responsibilities: Undertake primary research into customers and competitors
Work with our consulting team to determine their needs and goals by conducting interviews and surveys
Develop proposals and presentations based on research findings
Perform research tasks such as analyzing data sets or collecting information from industry experts
Present findings to clients using charts, graphs, and other visual aids such as PowerPoint presentations
Create operational plans based on available resources and aligning with organizational goals
Prepare reports summarizing research results and presenting them to management
qualifications: 2-4 years of experience in related fields
Excellent English speaker
Ability to present information in easy-to-understand formats
Strong attention to detail
Ability to identify and gather information from different sources
Intermediate or advanced Excel skills & PowerPoint

manager.title: Manager
manager.summary: ECMC is one of the largest local management consultancies in Saudi Arabia and the market leader in providing multidisciplinary services for both the private and public sectors. The company offers consulting solutions in the areas of Strategy, Marketing, Operations & Organizational Excellence, and Digital, serving a range of clients in both the public and private sectors. ECMC is heavily involved in the transformation era of Saudi Arabia, driven by the Vision 2030 initiative, working closely with various government organizations, Vision Realization Programs, and the private sector. The company has delivered projects in more than 17 sectors for some of the most prominent entities in the public sector, including ministries, regulatory authorities, and the Saudi Stock Exchange, as well as major private sector entities in the Kingdom. ECMC is looking for a Manager to join the team in Saudi Arabia. Ideally, you will have consulting experience gained through previous work experience.
responsibilities: Lead the day-to-day execution of a client project and assist in practice and solution development. Contribute to the creation of deliverables.
Manage client relationships on projects and ensure positive impact and sustainable results.
Direct the quantitative analysis, assess the depth required, and translate the analysis into useful findings and quality assure the results.
Take ownership of the overall project and delivery as per commitments to the client.
People management – handle a team of consultants, guiding and developing individual team members.
qualifications: 4.5 - 6.5 years of experience.
Previous experience in the consulting industry is A MUST.
Experience in Project Management, Policy & Procedure Development, Strategy Development, or Organizational Excellence.
Fluent in both Arabic and English (orally and written).
skills: Effective time management skills and the ability to multitask.
Excellent document development through MS Office.
Strong client and vendor management skills.

market-research-associate.title: Market Research Associate
market-research-associate.summary: The Market Research Associate plays a critical role in gathering and analyzing data to provide actionable insights that support strategic decision-making. The role involves conducting primary research, preparing comprehensive reports, and collaborating with teams to ensure findings align with client business objectives. This position requires strong analytical, communication, and project management skills, along with proficiency in research tools and data analysis methods.
responsibilities: Gather and analyze qualitative and quantitative data from primary research.
Track and monitor trends, market developments, and competitive activities to provide insights.
Design questionnaire and discussion guides that align with research objectives and gather relevant data.
Conduct surveys, interviews, and focus groups to capture customer insights and preferences.
Prepare comprehensive research reports, market assessments, and presentations to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with consulting teams and clients to understand research needs and ensure alignment with client business goals.
Oversee the execution of fieldwork to ensure high-quality data collection and timely project completion.
Work closely with the consulting team to ensure that research findings are integrated into broader client strategies and solutions.
Utilize industry-standard market research tools and methodologies to collect, organize, and interpret data.
qualifications: 2-4 years of experience in market research, business consulting, or data analysis, preferably in a consulting environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret large data sets and provide actionable recommendations.
Ability to understand business problems and provide research-based solutions to support strategic decision-making.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact with clients and stakeholders effectively.
Experience using market research tools and databases (e.g., Gartner, Statista), and proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools.
High attention to detail and ability to produce accurate and comprehensive research reports.
Experience managing multiple research projects, timelines, and deliverables.
Must be fluent in both English and Arabic.
educationAndAcademicExperience: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Statistics, or a related field; a master’s degree is a plus.

finance-manager.title: Finance Manager
finance-manager.summary: The Finance Manager plays a critical role in managing the accounting and financial functions of the organization. This position ensures compliance with accounting regulations, oversees financial reporting, and provides strategic insights to support decision-making. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, proven experience in finance management, and a commitment to fostering a culture of accuracy, integrity, and continuous improvement.
responsibilities: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the accounting department, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with accounting principles and regulations.
Manage the financial reporting process, including the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
Monitor and analyze financial data, providing key insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
Develop and implement accounting policies, procedures, and controls to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.
Coordinate and liaise with external auditors and tax authorities during audits and tax filings.
Stay updated on accounting regulations, industry trends, and best practices to ensure compliance and drive continuous improvement.
Lead, mentor, and develop a team of accounting professionals, fostering a positive work environment, and promoting professional growth.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field.
5-8 years of experience.
CPA or CMA certificate is a must.
Proven experience as a Finance Manager, or in a similar senior accounting role.
In-depth knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, and tax regulations.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial data and provide strategic insights.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting and analysis.
Advanced proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel. Experience with ERP systems is a plus.
Ability to effectively communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders.
Strong leadership skills with a track record of successfully managing and developing a team.
Demonstrated integrity, ethics, and commitment to maintaining confidentiality.
Fluent in English & Arabic.

office-administrator.title: Office Administrator
office-administrator.summary: We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Office Administrator to oversee and manage the daily operations of our office. Your role is to create and maintain a pleasant work environment, ensuring high levels of organizational effectiveness, communication, and safety.
responsibilities: Oversee and ensure the smooth running of day-to-day office operations, including supplies, equipment, and facilities.
Develop and implement office policies, procedures, and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Evaluate and select vendors and suppliers based on established office policies to ensure quality and cost-effectiveness.
Oversee financial administration related to office operations, including budgeting and expense tracking.
Coordinate and oversee travel arrangements and itineraries for staff and visitors.
Maintain excellent communication across departments.
Ensure a well-maintained office environment, including cleanliness, hygiene, and safety.
Organize and lead office events, conferences, and regular meetings (weekly, monthly, quarterly) to foster team collaboration and engagement.
Supervise and manage the office operations team, ensuring efficient task delegation, performance monitoring, and support.
Ensure adherence to legal and regulatory requirements relevant to office operations.
qualifications: Exceptional organizational and multitasking abilities.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
5-7 years of relevant experience in office management or administration.
Experience in a corporate or multinational environment is preferred.
Fluency in English and Arabic is mandatory, both written and spoken.
Ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
educationAndAcademicExperience: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
Preferably holds one of the following certificates: (COM, FMP).

hr.title: HR Operations Specialist
hr.summary: We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented HR Operations Specialist to support the day-to-day HR operations, ensuring smooth processes and compliance with local labor laws. The role involves managing employee data, facilitating onboarding and offboarding, and fostering a positive work environment through effective communication and engagement initiatives.
responsibilities: Execute day-to-day HR operations, including support in the first stage in onboarding, offboarding, and employee data management.
Maintain accurate and updated employee records in the ERP system.
Generate and analyze HR reports to support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure compliance and stay up-to-date with changes in local labor legislation.
Monitor and manage the probationary period for new hires, including evaluations and follow-up actions.
Act as a point of contact for HR-related inquiries from employees.
Assist in resolving employees’ issues and concerns, fostering a positive work environment.
Communicate company internal announcements, such as holidays and monthly gatherings.
Manage vacation requests in the ERP system.
Support other HR functions in activities such as engagements and events.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
0-3 years of experience in HR operations or a similar role.
Proficiency in MS Office and ERP systems.
Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong understanding of local labor law and company policies.
Exceptional organizational and multitasking abilities.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy in data management.
Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and discretion.
Excellent interpersonal skills.

it.title: IT Support Specialist
it.summary: As an IT Support Specialist, you will be the first point of contact for technical assistance and support within the organization. You will provide essential IT services to ensure the smooth operation of computer systems, software, and hardware. Your problem-solving skills, technical knowledge, and customer-focused approach are critical in this role.
responsibilities: Handle technical support for daily operational tasks.
Provide first-line technical support to internal users.
Manage and monitor device stock and lifecycle.
Liaise with outsourced IT support teams, ensuring timely resolution of issues.
Assist users with Microsoft Office applications and ERP Next system queries.
Troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues.
Ensure IT assets are well-maintained and meet company standards.
Assist in the onboarding process by setting up devices and accounts for new employees.
Provide feedback and recommendations on potential IT improvements.
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Network Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field or equivalent experience.
Familiarity with ERP Next, Microsoft Azure, Office applications, and user management.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience in managing and maintaining IT assets.
Fresh graduate with a maximum of 2 years of experience in a related field.
Fluent in English and Arabic, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Attention to detail, strategic thinking, and exceptional problem-solving skills.

partnership-specialist.title: Partnership Specialist
partnership-specialist.summary: The Partnership Specialist is responsible for managing relationships with partner companies and ensuring the efficient delivery of services at all levels. This role involves overseeing existing partnerships, enhancing service quality, and supporting project coordination.
responsibilities: Manage relationships with partner companies to ensure smooth service delivery.
Monitor partner performance and ensure compliance with service agreements and timelines.
Support project-level services, ensuring alignment between partners and internal teams.
Assist in drafting and managing partnership agreements.
Collaborate with internal teams to integrate partner contributions into project workflows.
Identify opportunities to enhance service delivery and work with partners to implement improvements.
Support partnership negotiations and agreement renewals.
qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in partnership management, vendor management, or project management.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience in management consulting or project-based environments is an advantage.
Certifications such as PMP or CIPS are a plus.
skills: Excellent relationship management and negotiation skills.
Strong organizational and project management capabilities.
Ability to handle multiple stakeholders and tasks simultaneously.

senior-advisory-operations-specialist.title: Senior Advisory Operations Specialist
responsibilities: Provide comprehensive project management support for all technical proposal-related tasks.
Receive RFPs from the government procurement platform.
Collect, organize, and archive all received RFPs in the shared drive.
Gather all required data from RFPs, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Conduct thorough analysis of business opportunities from RFPs, evaluating viability and strategic alignment.
Manage RFPs and other business opportunities within the ERP system, ensuring data integrity and timely updates.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to facilitate smooth proposal operations.
Identify and escalate potential issues or challenges to the relevant stakeholders.
Monitor all deadlines (submission dates, Q/A sessions, client meetings) to ensure timely compliance.
Support stakeholders in executing related initiatives effectively.
Develop and implement business development plans targeting key areas for growth.
qualifications: Minimum 4-5 years of experience in Operations or a related field.
Consulting experience is preferred.
In-depth understanding of the business development process and requirements.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to conduct comprehensive analyses of business opportunities.
Advanced reporting skills with experience creating detailed reports and data presentations.
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentations.
